item.description:
Gumi Chocolate Pine by Keralino Sandorovich (Japan, 2007, 190 min.)
Watch trailer

What: New Japanese Cinema: Gumi, Chocolate. Pine
When: 1:50 pm, Saturday, August 9, 2008
Where: Museum of Fine Arts, Remis Auditorium
Admission: $10 for adults, $8 for students

Here is a little blurb about the film from the MFA website
Kenji Otsuki’s novel, Gumi, Chocolate, Pine, grabbed the hearts of Japanese teenagers. The story has finally arrived on the big screen, featuring some of Japan’s most noted actors. Kenzo, an energetic teenager, forms a rock band with his friends, despite the fact that none of them play any instruments. Kenzo’s skips school lunches to see movies and dreams to make his own film one day. Director Sandorovich has created a sophisticated comedy full of ridiculous but loveable episodes of teenage life, with an ending that will pull on your heart strings.
item.name: Film Event: Gumi, Chocolate, Pine
